Does anyone know the right syntax for using chemkin-compatable 
kinetics in newIdealGasMix() function in Fortran? The manual 
(f77.pdf) suggests:

call newIdealGasMix('chem.inp','therm.dat')

but that causes memory protection fault and crashes the code. I 
figured out that the third parameter is necessary, and i guessed 
somethinhg like:

call newIdealGasMix('chem.inp', 'therm.dat', ''), or
call newIdealGasMix('chem.inp', '', 'therm.dat')

but in either case ctml writer finds an error:

~~~~~~~~~~
   Traceback (most recent call last):
     File "C:\Zoran\Chemkin II\other\cantera_premix\.cttmp.py", line 
7, in ?
       execfile(file)
     File "./chem.inp", line 2
       H
       ^
   SyntaxError: invalid syntax
~~~~~~~~~~

That is the first element, the line below the keyword ELEMENTS in 
chem.inp. The ck2cti accepts that chem.inp just fine, so I must be 
specifying arguments for newIdealGasMix() incorrectly...

If anyone knows what am I doing wrong here, the response would be 
much appreciated.

By the way, if you want to use xml-translated kinetics, it appears 
that the model import function needs again one argument more than in 
the f77.pdf suggests, likely the model ID you specified when ck2cti 
was run.

Sincerely,
           Zoran
